Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Indy Alternative”
Reviews.Author: pepper21_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for the Big Ten B-ball tourney. Although listed as a downtown hotel, the hotel is actually on the IUPUI campus. More than just a few blocks from the main attractions downtown. They do provide a free shuttle to the downtown area. The hotel itself was nice, relaxing. Rooms were clean. The staff and employees were friendly and helpful. Would stay here again when visiting Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you're visiting IU”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip to IU. If that's the reason you're coming to Indy, then this is a great place to stay. Location is great. Rooms are nice. Restaurant is mediocre. I ate lunch there and ordered the pappardelle. I didn't get pappardelle; I got spaghetti, and it wasn't cheap. My dining companion asked for a grilled cheese sandwich w/o tomatoes and got -- tomoatoes! But other than that, I would recommend this place to anyone who has work to do at IU.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby but the hotel isn't great”
Reviews.Author: Rick P
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived and checked in I went to my room. Walking in I could tell someone had been in the room. Used, wet towel on the night stand, used glass in the bathroom, and trash on the floor. The front desk attendant was pleasant and gave me another room; actually got an upgrade which was a little better but not great. Unfortunately the both rooms had an unpleasant odor. Also the rooms need updating, the furniture was stained, and bathroom was in need of some work. Also the walls in the rooms are paper thin - could hear talking and laughing in the room next door and across the hall. Also guests up all hours of the night. Could hear doors slamming, people walking in the halls, and commotion off and all all night. The hotel itself is not really downtown, at least not located close to where other hotels in the city are located but access to the conference center was convenient. They do offer a shuttle service which was nice. Not sure I would stay here again, but it was sufficient for a quick trip in and out of Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service and Aweful beds”
Reviews.Author: Nathan J
Reviews.Content: This hotel has terrible service. I was checking in and was assigned a room with two doubles. I asked if any other rooms were available. They said yes and said they had a "Corner King" I said ok sounds good. Next thing i know I wake up in the morning with an upcharge on my bill. Went to the front desk to dispute and was told a manager would call me. Still waiting on the phone call. The location is NOT downtown and is not close to anything downtown. The beds were terrible and the staff was rude. Took almost 45 mins to check in and the hotel was almost empty. Four people working behind the counter and only one helping people. TERRIBLE!!!>

Reviews.Title: “Complete Lack of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Cooper
Reviews.Content: My 76-year-old father needed cancer treatment at the hospital next to the University Place Hotel at the beginning of Super Bowl week. After we paid the *extremely* inflated Super Bowl price so we could use the covered walkway between this hotel and the hospital, they closed the walkway for anyone who didn't have NFL credentials. Never mind that my father had *cancer*. They made us go outside and walk to the hospital in the dark. When we were leaving, they wouldn't let us in the parking garage, because, again, we didn't have NFL credentials. (Never mind that they had charged us $18 to park there!) The only help the bully in the garage would offer is to tell me to go inside the hotel and ask for security to help me. I had to leave my father standing at the top of the garage (he had had cancer surgery only a couple of hours before this), and go get someone from security to escort me to my car. I thought these people were trained in "hospitality," but they couldn't even show the least bit of compassion or human kindness. Hospitality was completely off the table.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: DCmetrodogmom
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Clean space, which is v important to me 2. Clean duvet covers that get changed - hurrah! 3. Free wifi 4. Free shuttle that will take you downtown (this hotel is by IUPUI, so not near Circle Center) 5. On the IUPUI campus (have business here) 6. Front desk folks were helpful and welcoming Cons: 1. Walls were a little thin - could hear laughter in next room, and it didn't seem like the folks were being too raucous 2. Bed and pillows were a little hard. I prefer down. 3. Bathrooms were a little small given that this is Indiana and the rooms were large. Summary - If your business brings you near IUPUI, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Never book here”
Reviews.Author: clover11
Reviews.Content: Booked on Expedia. Cancelled 3 1/2 weeks before trip, emergency. Hotel told me 100% refundable. Expedia refused to refund. Hotel told Expedia they will not authorize refund. Hotel staff lied to me. I wish I had read reviews first as others could not get refunds either. I will stay elsewhere when I re-book my trip to Purdue. Chains such as Hilton, Marriot are safer to deal with. Almost every hotel on the planet refunds with 48 hour notice. FYI, not worth booking with Expedia anyway. Rates are generally the same when you book yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent University Based Hotel - Away from Downtown”
Reviews.Author: FINS103
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, nice restaurants/bars in hotel. Excellent staff and service. Hotel Shuttle was very convenient 9 times out of 10 to go downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great service”
Reviews.Author: camehome1517
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and offered valet parking to all guest with a service charge. The rooms were very clean and up to date. There wasn't much activity in the lounge or eatery as the weather was bad. We drove up for a Pacer game on the weekend and it appeared not to be very busy. Internet is included in the stay which is very handy. I did enjoy the time in this hotel and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Sickly odor made stay horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_FLBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am in this hotel right now. It is 12:30 a.m. and I am still awake because of a horrid chemical smell. I don't know if it is the air on the 9th floor in Indianapolis (smells like there's a paper mill in town), or if they are gluing carpets on another floor and that smell is coming through the air recycling units or this is the smell you get from making Ethanol or what - but I have not gotten to sleep and feel ill. Coincidentally, I look out my window and see the IU Simon Cancer Center. I am reminded of the smell they said permeated Beijing during the Olympics. I don't know if all Indy smells or just this hotel or just this room and my floor. I can't wait to leave this room and this hotel and this city so that I can breathe clean air again. This is NOT a 4-star hotel. I would never stay here again and I do not recommend this hotel. Also, the toilet wasn't cleaned properly and the location is only good if you're going to the cancer center or IUPUI campus.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: hnewheels
Reviews.Content: The only things 4-star about this hotel are the room rates and parking fees($18/night). What is definitely not 4-star is the customer service and cleanliness of the rooms. The rooms are nothing special, beds (we got 2 beds - definitely double, not queen), desk, tv and a dresser with a refrigerator in the cabinet (no microwave). The bathrooms are definitely one person at a time. Seriously, you open the bathroom door and you have a 2" clearance from the toilet. Either the walls are thin or the door is not fit properly to the frame, but we could hear every conversation of every person who passed outside our door. Both nights we were there we were kept up late and were woken up early by noises in the hallway. The only reason I would stay at this hotel is if it was important to be on the hospital or university campus. And then remember to bring your sleeping pills to ensure a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience, nice hotel with a few caveats...”
Reviews.Author: BigMikeColorado
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was a bit disappointed when my Hotwire reservation gave us this hotel. I read mixed reviews but went into it with an open mind, plus for about $80, it was a great deal. First, the location should not be considered "downtown". That being said, we didn't mind the fact that it was a few minutes away, it was quiet. The room was relatively nice, we were on the top floor and had a good view. The bathroom looked like it had not been updated in about 20 years and the shower was pretty dirty. One problem we experienced is that the door was really thin. We were there on New Year's eve and a party in the hallway kept us awake pretty late.

Reviews.Title: “Not really in downtown, but an okay stay.”
Reviews.Author: BusyMomIN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not in downtown Indianapolis, but over by the University and hospital area. I mention that because we got it through Hotwire and were very disappointed by the distance and inconvenience of accessing the downtown. . You could not walk or access public transportation easily, so you could not participate in the downtown activities without a car or taxi, and parking was an extra $18 per night self park or $24 for Concierge. Also, this was not a four star hotel as Hot wire claimed. The rooms were not clean enough or large enough, the tioletries were cheap and packaged in cardboard (not bottles) and were not even fresh (soap was used and left from last guest, note pad had one sheel of paper), drain was rusty and tub stained, bathroom so small you could not enter tub area or be on the toilet and close or open the door. Our first room smelled, so we changed rooms and got a much larger one with a view on the second try. There were problems with the room keys not being properly initialized and it took three trips to the front desk to get in a usable room with fresh toiletries. Our view was the downtown skyline; this is NOT downtown but in the University area. The beds were comfy and clean, carpets and decor nice, heating system quiet and perfect. but there was no pool, and everything cost extra. The first room they tried to give us was much smaller than the one we ended up with, but even the one we ultimately had (a very nice size and condition) had a small bathroom. I would have given it three stars for comfort, amenities and attitude. The concierge parking guys were nice, but the desk staff was just minimally nice.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0632
Reviews.Content: A bit on the pricier side. But location is good. Not too far from downtown Indy. Also walking distance to nearby taco bell and fast food chains. Was there for a conference and rooms were very nicely maintained. Ask for a room that has a view of the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “A non-traditional place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: rlbrown77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attend an annual event in downtown Indianapolis and typically get a downtown hotel room to stay in after the event. This year, I forgot to get reservations until about four weeks before the event, which now coincides with the Big 10 championship game in Indianapolis. There was one hotel with rooms left in downtown Indy, and they were at the University Place. I was a little scared, but we were pleasantly surprised. We had a corner King room on the 9th floor. The room was nice. Appeared to have been recently renovated. We had several friends visit and had plenty of space for everyone to sit and enjoy their stay. There were several fans of one of the Big Ten teams staying in the hotel, but we never noticed noise from their presence. We didn't try the food or the bar in the basement, but both were convenient, which is important given the distance from the core of "downtown". Staff was very helpful. The biggest complaint was the cost of valet parking, $24 for overnight. But, all-in-all, we very pleased with this non-traditional downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: tmoney1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, and the rooms were small but clean. Although it wasn't downtown, it was a short walk there and cabs were under 10 to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Willsman
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at University Place. Very convenient to downtown, campus location is a plus. View from hotel of downtown Indy made it even better. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and is close to a swimmeet”
Reviews.Author: Elise118
Reviews.Content: Very convenient clean rooms nice view too. The food was really good. When I walked in it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Wonderful service and great food.”
Reviews.Author: Hiptraveler1
Reviews.Content: Great surprise for the price! Friendly staff and a great bar

Reviews.Title: “Rather dated and in the middle of no where”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: Not a nice place to stay at. Was booked through a work conference and not happy with my stay. Place is far from the city centre and while they offer a 'free' (i.e. you pay as much in tips as you would outside the US pay for a cab) shuttle, waiting for that is not very convenient and calling it up on your way back such a hassle that most people in my conference group cabbed it into down town the whole time. Staff at property are rather unfriendly and while luckily my booking was all fine, I can very well imagine what kind of service you'd get from those reception dragons if anything was wrong. Exception are the bell boys who obviously need to appear friendly to get those tips they are after. Wifi is free but an extreme hassle to constantly sign in again with a out-of-this-world endless passport which is a true "joy" to enter 55 times a day. Rooms themselves are quite spacious but beds uncomfortable and pillows filled with some cheap plastic material instead of feathers which felt awful. Bathroom looks very old and dated and ammenities come in little cardboard satchels rather than the usual little bottles which, of course, is all for the environment but luckily coincides which this hotel's obvious cost saving measures. Alarm clock at bedside shines brighter than a spaceship (and looks like one!), after unplugging it the housekeeper plugged it back in until I ended the fight by placing a note on the spaceship indicating that I wish to keep it unplugged. Gym facility really crap and no pool of its own (I read something that you can use the uni pool or similar- very generous and no thank you!).

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Hotel, Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: dabev
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business, a conference. Room was very nice, actually, looked updated in terms of linens and carpet, but the bathroom was like stepping into a different century. Others have mentioned it here, but the showers and general tiling were pretty moldy. The "conference" rate was $186/night, for a Sunday and Monday, way higher than other options we normally choose in downtown. I ordered takeout dinner and ate lunch in The Den, which was just OK. The staff in the evening seemed far friendlier than that during the day. Valet guys out front were chatty and friendly, would have liked to see that translate to the front desk. The conference facilities were quite average, we used a number of large and small rooms throughout the center. I am an avid gym fan, found this one to be well-equipped, but have grown accustomed to individual screens for cardio machines, this fitness center had two large screen among the cardio and was in need of towel replenishment. If you are in need of a hotel close to the hospitla, this is the place, but not sure I would otherwise visit here, would rather be downtown with its amenities, and hotels seem better/cheaper there.

Reviews.Title: “Boiled egg exploded”
Reviews.Author: Norrlandska
Reviews.Content: Nice room. However, the chef apparently did not know how to boil an egg.. Asked for a boiled egg for breakfast, and the waiter looked very surprised over me ordering something not presented in the menue. Anyway, he took the order. I got the egg in a bowl (?), with no egg shell. Upon trying to eat it, I put à knife into the egg and the next thing that happens is that the egg explodes! All over me and my colleage, on the floor, on the table- what à mess! I ordered scrambled eggs instead and the waiter told me that I did not have to pay for the boiled egg!!! What à joke!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Rap Because of Priceline”
Reviews.Author: snake2
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Priceline for $63/night. Asked for a downtown Indy, 4-star hotel. Like other reviewers, I was surprised that Priceline would consider this a downtown Indy hotel or a 4-star hotel. However, there is nothing wrong with this place - it is a good hotel. 4-star? no. Downtown ? No. I understand why people are upset at Priceline about this point. Fortunately, I did not absolutely need to be in downtown Indy proper - or I would've just lost the money on this and made a different reservation. FYI - If you don't mind shuttling or walking to downtown, you will be happy here. I was happy here. Staff was good, room was very comfortable and clean. It was all I needed it to be. With all that said, I am reconsidering Priceline. Obviously, they have changed their strategy to get more business. If I were management at this hotel, I would sever my relationship with Priceline; it is surely hurting their business for no good reason. I am reconsidering MY relationship with priceline over this one - I am a long-time, loyal Priceline customer, but probably no more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, just be aware it is not as local to Circle Center area as some others. They do have a shuttle which runs often so this isn't that big of a deal. I have no idea why anyone wouldn't like this facility, it is very nice and the staff is very courteous. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location”
Reviews.Author: LynnesPicks
Reviews.Content: This was our hotel that we were given after our $70.00 per night bid on Priceline. I was so disappointed that I called them and tried to change it but they said no. We checked in with very low expectations after what I read on other posts. My husband shared our concerns to John at the front desk who upgraded us to a corner room with the city view. This was nice but for the purpose of this trip we needed to be downtown for meetings etc. This hotel is NOT! If you have a student @ IUPUI or someone at the medical center then it is a perfect location. To call this a downtown location is very misleading on the part of Priceline. We saved money but that was it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne D
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful hotel, would have like to stay here for pleasure but, my husband was a patient at IU hospital. The hotel is attached to the hospital by a sky walk, which I used at 6:30 a.m. The area is very safe. The staff was so helpful, they were very welcoming and concerned about our comfort. We received a very nice note from the Manager. We will be going back again in a few weeks for a longer time. This is our indy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4-STAR NO MATTER HOW YOU SLICE IT”
Reviews.Author: Albert C
Reviews.Content: 4-Star? You have to be JOKING!!! No way, never, not going to make the grade. There is no confusion over this issue. This is not even close to being a 4-star hotel. It is dirty (no, filthy) in the hallways. The doors to all the rooms are so dirty, that they look like the inside of a college dorm room. I got this room from Priceline. It is so bad here that I seriously considered losing the money I paid to Priceline and checking into another hotel. If you have ANY options to stay some place else.....THEN DO IT!! This place is 2.5 stars at best. It is run down and the staff is so indifferent to the complaints....it is as if they hear the same thing every day and have become immune to the comments. Well, they should get used to it, because I don;t think they care and I doubt that they will do anything to change anything. Good Luck. And, by the way...for me to complain....it has to be bad.

Reviews.Title: “Some things great....others poor”
Reviews.Author: Entlebuch
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review because the level of service and amenities were so variable. This is not a 4 star hotel and I would not pay full price but it is worth a Hotwire or Priceline booking. Positives: Great conference facilities and food service, free fast internet (wireless and wired in rooms), good location for medical school meetings. Not a terrible location for the museums and stadium when the weather is nice and if you enjoy walking. Not so positive: Almost $20 per day parking charges are a total rip-off for a location more than a mile from downtown. You can park for $5 per day around the corner in the medical building underground parking garage. Negative: The front desk supervisor should find a different career field. She was extremely rude and unhelpful. She acted as if people at her desk were imposing on her time. In contrast, the other front desk staff members I spoke to were pretty good once they warmed up. I think that supervisor creates a poor workplace environment and they all suffer as a result. No doubt that she affected my overall rating as well.

Reviews.Title: “almost a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: dryad-fw
Reviews.Content: The biggest issue in the reviews seems to be centered around the star rating for this hotel. I truly believe that if it had a recognised brand name attached to it there would be little debate over this being rated 4 star based on its amenities. A large lobby welcoming you with fruit-infused water and fresh fruit, beautifully furnished and decorated, friendly and knowledgeable desk clerks, a concierge and valet parking. The room was large, extremely clean, well appointed with a desk and ergonomic chair, bedside tables, dresser, reading chair- and though the furnishings may have been slightly dated, they were quality pieces. Flat panel TV. Bed linens were clean and crisp, large fluffy towels and spa quality soap, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion provided in single use dispensers. Gormet coffee and teas with an in-room coffee maker. Iron/board and hairdryer in working order. Room service was available and there was a restaurant on site. The bar was very inviting, lively, not overpriced. These are the things that I feel classify a hotel in the four star range. There were a few areas that needed refreshed- the carpet and wallpaper in the hallways of some floors had seen better days; there was some rust around the drain in the shower; minor chips in the vanity, but I find that to be just normal wear and tear in a busy hotel. Self-parking in a connected garage was $18, an average parking fee for the city. The location is not in the center of downtown, but It certainly is within a mile or so walking distance to Mass Ave, the zoo, the canal and some downtown attractions, without having the central downtown price tag. (example, from hotel to Murat Theatre was a pleasant 20 min walk.) I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: pugluv
Reviews.Content: 1st this hotel is not in downtown. 2nd the service is horrible and front desk people are rude and not helpful. 3rd $20 for parking and its not in downtown?!?!?!?! I would only stay here again if stuck from Priceline or Hotwire, never by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Business Functions”
Reviews.Author: ilona06
Reviews.Content: I managed a leadership development program in conjunction with University Place for both conference and hotel space. The hotel was very clean, and service from the moment I pulled my car up to the hotel until checkout was first-rate! Conference facilities were also excellent, and communication with all UP personnel was fast and efficient. Complimentary shuttle bus to downtown Indianapolis locations a huge plus. Food served both in the restaurants and during conference, as well as room service, all exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that tried hard”
Reviews.Author: vermontgirl16
Reviews.Content: With the university lecture halls connected to the hotel, this is a great place to hold a conference. The University hotel is a utilitarian hotel that has all the amenties that a traveler needs except a pool. The halls leading to my room were worn but my room was nice...very comfortable king sized bed, adequate albeit refurbished bathroom, comfotable chair and ottamen, refrigerator and 4 cup coffe maker. As other reviewers, I found the walls very thin...I was four rooms from the elevator and could hear the announcement bell; also, my door had a large gap at the threshold so not only could I hear the hall noise, my room was illuminated all night. I also found that the hot water took a long time to come to the 8th floor. As other travelers commented,this hotel is not downtown but there is a shuttle which was satisfactory. 8th floor but once it was hot, it stayed hot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location but expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: StreetImports
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great location. 15 minutes from Brickyards. Free shuttle to Downtown. Expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and ez to get around!”
Reviews.Author: JamesinGermany
Reviews.Content: Got my reserve on Hotwire for $70 per night. Great hotel, secure parking($18/day) and the shuttle was a real plus! no worries about drinking and driving because you would be delivered downtown and picked up later. When the shuttle stopped, the hotel paid for a taxi - bonus! Close to the track(MOTOGP) and the breakfast was convenient and very good. I will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff could have enhanced experience”
Reviews.Author: GlobL
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire and stayed for a few days. The hotel location is great as it is 5-10 minutes away from downtown and the hotel has a shuttle service. There is also a city bus service which runs a shrt route between the campus an downtown, with a stop right in front of the hotel. The room was fine: roomy with a really comfortable king bed. Restaurant staff were friendly. The disappointments were the shuttle bus not picking us up from downtown the second time we used it and the unfriendly front desk staff on check-in. Some maps of the area would also have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT DOWNTOWN!!!! this is a 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4*** hotel. This is a relatively nice 3 star hotel. (a big lobby, a few restaurants, and a small gym). However, there remains much to be desired... On the website it offers bottled water in the gym!!! This is an outright LIE!! there is no bottled water in the gym.. very misleading... infact the gym has little cups that u drain the water from a big jug!!! There are no toilets in the gym and the excersise equipment is 3 star at best.. The rooms are 2.5 star.. maybe 3 star.. the bathtubs have mould on the tiles (am surprised the health inspectors dont see this)... the soaps they offer in the bathroom are so small that they look like alka-seltzer. The pillows and thier cases are filthy dirty. They smell like sweat and are not feathered. The desk chairs are all damaged and with my luck, mine was broken They have no concierge.. WHAT 4 STAR HOTEL HAS NO CONCIERGE ... LOL The staff at the front desk Amanda Zobrist (front dest PM Supervisor) never smiles (except when she talking to her boss)!! She did not want to honor our request, as simple as they were.. a non-smoking floor/room with a king bed if she had it.. and believe me she had plenty... (as we found out the next day from her colleauge) Not sure what that was all about.. Also this hotel is NOT downtown.. sucks how they lied about this.. i was really looking forward to walking around downtown as my wife has a poor knee and would have been nice to wheel here around on the side walks.... This realy messed up my plans.. There is no SAFE in the room for my passport.. THIS IS RETARDED.. ALL 4 STAR HOTELS HAVE A SAFE!!! ok enough.. It would be in there best interest to be honest and rate this hotel accordingly!!.. This is a 3 star hotel, on the west side of downtown Indy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jhaunt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a discount website at $76/night. I didn't know which hotel until after the purchase but the price was right. The hotel was pretty clean and the grounds were very pretty. I only had 2 encounters with the staff, checking in and out. Both check in and out were fairly quick. During checkout the front desk person didn't even look up, ask how our stay was, or say thank you. It was just as if she was doing me the favor by checking me out. The other posters that complain about noise are right on the money. You could hear everything from someone else taking a shower to people in the hall. There is not a pool at the hotel. You can purchase passes to go to the university pool which is a block or so away. This hotel is a very long walk from downtown. My experience wasn't bad, but if I go to Indy again, I will stay somewhere closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “No way would I stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jaynsummer
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a four-star hotel. It's a two-star, at best. It's a very old hotel that someone threw some money at. The air conditioning works horribly... we moved rooms at 1:30 a.m. when our A/C failed to cool down the room after being in there for four hours. Second room worked marginally better, but still slept on top of the sheets. Pillows are like at grandma's house, with folded-over lines in the middle. Yuck. It's a standard hotel bed, no pillow top or plushness. Nice carpet, tiny TV, remote controls in both rooms had the numbers rubbed off on the remotes, so you could not tell what button you were pushing. Bathroom was typical of a hotel built in the 1970s, with modern counters and some updates. The bathtubs were original and showerheads were high enough for a five foot five woman, but not my six foot four husband. When we complained about the no a/c in the first room, we were offered another room, but that was it... no discounts or anything. Upon checkout, we did get free parking, but feel that we still should have gotten money back. Would not recommend this place unless you have work to do on the campus. It is NOT a hotel for travelers, leisure, family or likewise. Also, had kids (college students) hanging out in the lobby when we checked in around 8:30 p.m. When we changed rooms at 1:30 a.m., they were STILL there, eating pizza and playing cards. You'd think this was a frathouse, not a hotel. YUCK. Also, there is no pool unless you want to go to the university center that is blocks away for a charge. BOO.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok - Probably Would Choose Another Property”
Reviews.Author: Lois6848
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property 2 nights because I was taking a Fundraising Seminar that was located at the the conference center in the hotel. The infused water in the hotel lobby was wonderful -- the hotel room was like this: mold in the caulking of the tub, and the body pillow smelled of body oils. Ick! The first night I stayed I slept well; next morning I showered and hung the bath towel over the shower bar to use the next day (go green!). When I returned to the room after the first day's class, the towel I was "recycling" was gone, and so was the clean bath towel I never touched. Also some minor thing was missing from my cosmetic case that I used the evening before. I called the front desk to get towels replenished and was glad I discovered it when I did, otherwise I would have had to dry off with a hand towel the next morning. The second evening I did not sleep well due to noise in the hallway at 4:00 am. I opened the door and asked the young couple to be quiet since it was 4:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MDPIowaCity
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel. Great location if you are in a business trip to IUPUI. They have a very good restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel. Close to downtown Indy.”
Reviews.Author: carmelrunners
Reviews.Content: I know, I know, there seems to be a bit of an issue with everyone commenting on whether this is a four star hotel. If you have ever been to a real four star hotel or higher it would be obvious that it is not. The hotel is NOT downtown. Can you walk from the hotel to downtown? Yes. Would you want to walk that far? NO. Especially if you plan to eat or drink at a nice restaurant downtown. What this hotel does make up for in location is a speedy shuttle with friendly service. I think the fact they will pick you up at just about any location including the mass ave. area is great. I tipped the driver each time because he was so speedy and friendly and I appreciated the door to door service. The doorman / valet was extremely helpful and friendly on check-in and even ran up to the front door and opened it for my wife and he seemed genuinely happy to provide good service for the hotel patrons. I watched him while waiting for the shuttle and he was very friendly to all guests. The girl at the front desk was nice and gave us an upgrade because either our room wasn't ready or we insisted on a non-smoking room, either way we were happy. The upgraded room actually had a pretty good view of downtown and the size a bit larger than a standard room. The one complaint would be the TV was a bit small for the distance to the bed but for the ten minutes I turned it on it wasn't a big deal. We only ate breakfast at Chancellor's in the morning and the food was excellent. I read a few bad comments about the food but don't hesitate to try the breakfast. I think the price was fair also. The sports bar was pretty good the bartender on duty seemed friendly and would make strong drinks. Personally I prefer a perfectly mixed drink but I think the younger clientele may want more bang for the buck. Nothing good or bad to say about the sports bar just went in for a nightcap. I rated this place highly because even though I don't think it is a four star hotel, the service was excellent. I do think the service is 4 stars and that means more to me than the facility any day of the week. It is an excellent almost 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay Here - it is 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: So this hotel is a AAA 4 Diamond hotel (they proudly display the 2011 AAA 4 Diamond Award at reception), and after two visits I agree with AAA that it is 4 star quality. The last time I stayed here was a few years ago (and posted a review on TripAdvisor). Since we stayed here last weekend, I read more recent reviews and got worried. I think the negative reviews are due to people winning this hotel on Priceline (as I did for a steal of a price) and being disappointed its not directly downtown (though in the downtown zone). They do offfer a free shuttle downtown, and honestly we walked back (its not that long of a walk, all through parks and the campus). The hotel is perfectly clean, the rooms very well kept, and the beds are great. The front desk staff was a bit slow to help us (and we were the only one's there). We ate breakfast at the resturant, and it was fabulous! My only compliant is the parking. It was $18, which I decided to pay with my room charge. When we left, the gate was open and no attendent...I guess we should've elected to pay cash to the attendent as we would've saved $18. Regardless, given its location, parking should be free to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great for IUPUI”
Reviews.Author: Pferdina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending meetings at IUPUI, and the hotel was really nice. The staff was excellent every time I needed to interact with them. I stayed in a Junior Suite, which had a little sitting area and a kitchenette closet in addition to bed, desk, and TV. A friend of mine was in a regular room which was also nice, but a little smaller. The rooms were clean and neat, there were plenty of soaps and other items in the bathroom. No bathtub but the shower was fine. I did not have any trouble with the wi-fi in the room. There is no pool, but I think there is an exercise room (I didn't try to find it). My room had lots of big windows, making it light and airy, and the view of downtown Indianapolis was nice. My one negative was with the air handler in the room, which was next to the bed and made windy sounds all night. It did not prevent me from sleeping, but it seemed louder than necessary. Parking was in an underground garage and it was pretty expensive ($20/day I think), but guests can go in and out as many times as they want. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy. The clerk at the desk was even able to provide me with driving directions to and from the airport. Free cookies, fruit, and lemonade were available in the lobby in the afternoons. The hotel has a small restaurant and a sports bar and I tried both. The food at the bar was typical bar stuff (mostly sandwiches, deep-fried things) and there was a decent selection of drinks including some local beers. The restaurant was also good when I ate there for breakfast. Plenty of choices, food tasted good and was pleasantly presented and the staff was attentive. The prices weren't outrageous, which was good since there aren't too many other nearby choices unless you want to eat at one of the university or hospital food courts. Downtown would be a long hike from this hotel for most people, but anyone attending an event on campus would be fine here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not a four star”
Reviews.Author: th673789
Reviews.Content: The University Place Hotel is vey nice, but not a four star as it is labeled. They do not have the ameneties that four stars usually do, no pool, hot tub or spa on site. The room was clean and decent, but nothing special. The shuttle service to and from downtown was excellent, but having to pay $24 a day to just leave your car in their garage is outrageous. Next time, we will look for a place closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for business at IUPUI”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: University hotels are often not quite up to snuff but this hotel is the exception. The room was clean, quiet, and nicely equipped. The only major deficiency from a business traveller perspective was the lack of an in-room safe. The location is great for business at IUPUI but a bit far away from downtown Indianapolis, so I wouldn't recommend this place if you need to be downtown or at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: aruba70
Reviews.Content: We bid on priceline for a 4* room downtown and got University Place. THEN we read the reviews. We were just going to "donate" our $ to Priceline after reading them and stay at the new JW Marriott downtown. We finally decided that even if we stay one night at the University Place and leave the room empty for our 2nd night and go to JW Marriott than we are still saving money. So... we got there, my husband checked in. He messaged me that there were 3 people in front of me - so I thought, here we go... it is going to be 15-20 minutes to check-in. But he was back in 5 and he said there was one person at the desk.. he said the lobby looked nice. OK, so far so good and I kept thinking how gross the room will be BUT we got into our room and it was very nice and very clean. I was very impressed. Bed was fine, shower was fine. Breakfast was good but it did take a bit longer than normal to receive and it was fairly expensive. We continued to debate our move to the JW and finally decided that there really wasn't anything bad except the location, which was NOT downtown. But during our 2nd evening, we did experience some loud neighbors who had the tv on and were yelling while they were getting ready to go out at midnight. Anyway, all was pretty good except location. Everyone was very nice. We even got cookies and bottled water in the evening. Very pleased. Maybe we were lucky with a nice room (they did upgrade us to a Junior Suite). healthclub was decent... pool was a few blocks away

Reviews.Title: “Horrible for business- stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: minnesnowtachris
Reviews.Content: Poor internet wireless. Away from everything even though the hotel looks like it's in downtown. Really sophomoric front desk service. No knowledge of surrounding area. I would spend the extra money to be sure I got the Marriott or JW Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not best service, 3rd floor is smoking floor”
Reviews.Author: apence10
Reviews.Content: We were in Indianapolis for a concert and when we arrived at the hotel, our floor (3rd) smelled awful, like someone had been smoking. Being a non-smoking pregnant lady, I did not want to deal with smoke smells and toxins. Therefore, I went to the front desk to inquire about whether this was a smoking free facility. They informed me that 3rd floor is the only floor which allows smoking. I asked to be moved to another floor, because of being pregnant and it not being safe. They said they were booked solid and we could not be moved. We were staying for multiple nights though, so could check back and see if we could switch the next night. Our room did not smell like smoke, and it was a busy weekend in Indianapolis, or I would have tried finding another hotel to stay at for the weekend! When I went back the next day to see if I could switch like they had said before, they said that they were booked again and it would not be possible. The front desk lady was very rude and I stood at the counter for 3-4 minutes before she even acknowledged me. I was not happy with the service of the front desk staff. However, I did enjoy the bartender, who made me a virgin bloody mary! :) I would suggest that this hotel work on their customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are too thin!”
Reviews.Author: zsilvereyes2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went through Priceline and wanted a downtown hotel. We ended up with this hotel and it's not even walking distance to downtown. Parking is $18. We didn't have a problem with service but their walls are so thin that we could hear everything that was going on in the next room and hallways. There were kids wrestling in the next room and partying from midnight-4am. People were running up and down the hallways. Worse hotel to try to get a good night sleep. Would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Two words: AVOID it!”
Reviews.Author: RedSpring
Reviews.Content: Booked a 78 dollar rate at Hotwire. Not worth it. Had to pay 18 dollars pr day for parking. Very slow staff when checking in. Waited 20-25 minutes. Only two couples in front of me. Location is terrible, 1.5 miles from downtown. There are NO restaurants or anything nearby. Shuttle is always late and slow. I experienced anything from 20-50 minute waits despite several calls to Hotel Room is noisy because of poorly insulated doors Internet access is cumbersome. You have to type in a long username and long password everytime you log on. Not a single soul eats a the hotel restaurant. So there you have it: Slow and sometimes rude staff, location in the middle of nowhere, poor shuttle service, lack of food options, lack of nearby restaurantrs, overpriced parking, cumbersome internet. In short, avoid this place. Its a trap.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: goblueaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel would have been fine for $99 but for $179 plus taxes and parking I expected more. The front desk staff reminded me of Department of Motor Vehicles emplyees. They were rude and unhelpful with an attitude. The room and location were good but I would not stay there again. The hotels closer to downtown Indy are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline and University Place - good luck”
Reviews.Author: HauteTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms on Priceline and ended up with University Place. Strike one: I seriously question the "downtown" rating that Priceline gives it as you cannot walk to anything "downtown" from this location. It's a cab or car ride to any sporting event, shopping or downtown restaurant. If you are needing to be near the IUPUI campus or medical centers, it's perfect. Strike two: We checked in at 5:00 PM and were told all 3 of our rooms were not ready. Since we had dinner reservations at 5:30 PM and tickets for an event at Lucas Oil, we were told by the front desk they would store our luggage until we returned and checked in, which we said would be around 10:00 PM. Strike three: We arrived around 10:00 PM to find that the hotel was overbooked and they only had two of our three rooms (which we already paid for). In addition, our confirmation for double beds for three staying in each room wasn't available and those were now king beds. Rollaways were ordered and they would credit the $14.00 parking fee for the inconvenience (that was an amusing offer). As for the third room, we were given the standard "walk letter" for a room at the Columbia Club and I packed up my 7 and 12 year olds and we went out into the cold night via a cab to the Columbia Club and finally got checked into a room around 11:15 PM and two plus miles away from other members of our party and the vehicles we all came in. Connecting for breakfast and the return home was an additional inconvenience. When I asked why they didn't tell us at 5:00 PM there was a problem and they, in fact, didn't have three rooms available, no one could answer me. Upon checking into the Columbia Club, I was told by the desk attendant that they see this a lot and the University Place/Priceline team is great at overbookings. Bottomline, if you use Priceline for a "downtown" hotel be careful. If you end up with University Place, good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Beware they don't deliver on added services”
Reviews.Author: CraigT54
Reviews.Content: This is a great location if you're prepping for a visit to the Med Center next door and it's in a quiet area near downtown but know there are some drawbacks largely with service. Check-in was terribly inefficient. Long lines with slow, tedious clerks. Try not to arrive around 4pm. The hotel phone service is unacceptable. I called several times to get directions or to learn of on site services and each time had holds in excess of 12 minutes. Once you connect they pass you on to another hold. The restaurant service was minimal (buffet only - no ala carte orders) and the second restaurant was closed. Not much else nearby. We ended up eating breakfast at the Hospital cafeteria across the street. There are no restaurants nearby which leads to the final problem - the so called free Shuttle service. Several times they made a point of referencing their free shuttle to downtown. The waits are long and the pick ups very sporadic. We ended up having to cab it downtown. When I called for a return pickup after dinner told me it would arrive shortly. Downstairs the bellman it left 5 minutes earlier. A call to the hold and a long hold later we were told one was on the way. It never showed. I called again and after a hold was told they would call me back. Never called. I called again and learned they were trying to line up a shuttle. We ended up taking a cab again and then 45 minutes later while we're in bed they call to ask if we're still waiting for the shuttle. Rooms are pleasant, lobby is large for meeting with friends but they don't have the customer in mind at this place. If you get this one on a blind draw it's tolerable, if you're staying here ahead of a hospital visit it's convenient but if you're here for downtown - I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charge $18/day for self-park and $24 for valet”
Reviews.Author: BusyTraveling36990
Reviews.Content: This not so special hotel charges higher than average prices. As a 20 year resident of Indianapolis, I am aware of the amenities and costs of numerous hotels around the city. If you want to be charged luxury hotel prices, for an average nights stay, then this is the place for you! I live 20 minutes outside of the city and only stayed at the hotel because the business meeting I was attending paid for my hotel room. Unfortunately, they did not pay for the ridiculous parking, food, and beverage costs I incurred. If you are visiting from out of town, I recommend cabbing from the airport!!!

Reviews.Title: “University Place - Great stay for early appointment at IU Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight prior to a scheduled early morning surgery for a family member. Hotel is very nice, very large, very plush. There is an attached second story covered walkway that takes you...... to the outer wall of the IU Medical Center...... yes, that is right, it takes you to the outside of the IU Med Center, not into the building. There is an elevator at the IU Med Center end of the walkway, take note if you have an early morning appointment at IU, the elevator does not operate around the clock. I think it starts running around 7 am. Either way, once you get to the ground floor, you will need to walk about 100 feet to the IU Med Center entrance. Seems like connecting the end of the walkway to the hotel itself and allowing you to walk into the second floor of the hospital would have been prudent for all concerned? The wouldn't have needed an elevator for the walkway at all. If you park at the hospital and walk through the walkway into the hotel, be advised, there are no markings to tell you which way to go to find the desk. If you do this, turn right as soon as you pass the edge of the wall, look for the huge stair case heading down or look to the right again for the elevators, go down to the ground floor and you wiil see the desk as you exit the elevators or arrive at the bottom of the stairs. If your appointment is early, you will either have to walk down two flights of stairs or walk out the front of the hotel and across the street, up the drive to get to the IU Med Center entrance. The hotel was nice enough to send a valet to pick up a wheelchair the morning of the surgery to get the patient across the road quickly (very cold that morning). They were asked about that the evening before and assured us they would have the wheelchair at the front desk at 5:30 am for us, it either wasn't there or it was locked up and they didn't have an access key. Oh, the fire alarm at 4:30 would have been aggravating also, if we hadn't planned on getting up at that time to get ready for the day. Evidently, the cold weather routinely sets off the fire alarm in the winter season? Plan on taking your own alarm clock or using the wake up service, the alarm in the room was off an hour (must not automatically adjust for daylight savings time?) and even though I am pretty good at figuring out digital settings, I gave up trying to set the time on this one. You can always set your alarm off an hour like I did, easier to just use your cell phone alarm. Other than those few oddities, the hotel was very nice. When we arrived and realized we didn't know where to go to check in, we called the hotel number (luckily we had that number in our phone) and they graciously sent someone to retrieve us and guide us to the desk. If you want luxurious surroundings, this is a good bet in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View of Indianapolis at Night!”
Reviews.Author: Skye9988
Reviews.Content: I spent the night at this hotel, and honestly, I was concerned before we got there. I'd taken a risk and chosen an "unnamed" four star hotel for on Expedia.com for a deal. After paying, the name was revealed, so I came here to check out the reviews, and many of them were negative. After reading through these reviews, I thought I'd made a big mistake, but since it was a non-refundable purchase, I planned to just make the best of it. Maybe it's because I went there expecting the worst, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel was an excellent place to stay. When we first arrived, at least I knew about the parking fee ahead of time from reading the reviews. We went ahead and parked our own car, and took the conveniently located elevators which delivered us right to the lobby. (Valet parking was available, but completely unnecessary.) Our check in was quick, and I avoided having a hold placed on my debit card by providing cash to be held overnight. Have $75 with you when you go there, and they'll take cash for the "incidentals fee" and they'll return it to you upon check out, minus the $18 parking fee. ( If you don't mind having a hold put on your debit or credit card, just beware that their sign states the hold may be up to five days.) We then went up to our room on the 9th floor. I got a room with one king sized bed, and it was fabulous. When we opened the curtains and saw the beautiful sight of Indianapolis at night, it was amazing. The room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable. It had a warm comforter, as well as a blanket, so it was very cozy. There were numerous pillows, as well as two body pillows which were a nice touch, I thought. The flat screen tv was nice. The room itself was attractive and even minor details made a lovely difference. For example, the desk chair was very comfortable, and it even had lumbar support--I could have fallen asleep in that chair! There was a little fridge hidden in a cabinet under the tv. There was also a comfy chair with an ottoman near the window, along with plenty of lighting. Our room was located near the elevators, and occasionally I could hear people pass by in the hall, but there was no disruptive noise. We could not hear through the walls, so I slept very well. I would return to this hotel again, and I was actually very sorry I had to leave. The view alone was worth the price I paid. Aside from the room, the hotel itself is attractive. It has a well-appointed, comfortable lobby area where people could gather with friends to visit. There were two computers available for guest use in the lobby, as well. (There is a business center, but unfortunately it was closed when I arrived.) My only criticism of the hotel would be that I don't think their location should be listed as "downtown." Thank goodness I had my car, and I have GPS on my car because the drive to our downtown destinations took quite a few minutes, and there were a few twists and turns and one-way streets. If I'd booked this hotel and expected to be able to walk to anyplace downtown, I'd have been unhappy. In the summer this might not be too much of an issue for people who don't mind a bit of a walk, but in the dead of winter, it would be miserable.

Reviews.Title: “The Poor Service Overshadowed the Quality”
Reviews.Author: IndyCessnaPilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and had my son in tow. I was extremely tired upon check-in and went to bed immediately, as my son watched TV. I was awakened by my 11 year-old who was worried about the fire alarm which had been going off for a while. I called the front desk to complain and learned that they decided to test the alarm at 5:30 p.m. The desk offered no apology and simply stated "I don't know" when asked how long the annoyance would persist. Then, I couldn't get back to sleep, so we ordered a pizza (mainly because I was too tired to go out). We received a cell phone call from the delivery driver who stated that the hotel wouldn't allow the delivery to the room. When I called the desk to see if they would just let him up, I was told there was no way he was coming to my room. Now, the hotel staff stated the reason for this policy because pizza delivery drivers are frequently robbed in hotels. You're right -- this is absurd. The true reason these hotels do this is to frustrate competition with their room service. If it were really a security concern, then why not escort the driver to the room, or have some other arrangement other than inconvenience the guest. This trip required me to get fully dressed, comb my hair, put on my shoes and socks, and walk down to the lobby from the 5th floor, find the driver in the crowded lobby, and then venture back to the room. In whatever profits the hotel believes it is earning from preventing the convenience of a pizza delivery, it will lose in lost room revenue. OTHERWISE, this is a very clean and comfortable hotel. They have subscribed to the cheapest cable TV package on the market, so keep this in mind if you are with children. However, it was comfortable and clean. Oh, and the initial lady who checked us in was quite pleasant. Short of an unlawful or crazy request, "no" has no place in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location if you have UIPUI business”
Reviews.Author: JoKnits
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night when visiting UIPUI. Check-in was efficient, and there was a lovely bowl of fruit at the front desk for the taking. The rooms are fairly standard. The pillows were ok - not great. The room was adequately clean. Overall, I'd say "good, but a bit dated". I had lunch at the restaurant there - the bison meatloaf was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice if you want to be next to the hospital - IUPUI!”
Reviews.Author: euscarol
Reviews.Content: Had a family member in the hospital - IUPUI. It was right next door. The closest to the hospital. Had a nice walkway across to the hospital. I was coming and going all hours of the day and night so it was perfect. Nice lobby areas to sit in and free internet connections. Also, have computers downstairs that guests can use for free. I travelled with two teens so they loved using the computers and going to the gym. The gym is nice too. Paid a little higher price than I wanted to but given the location it was the best choice. The teens could hang out in a comfortable area while I was at the hospital. Over the Thanksgiving holiday the sports bar was open for food. The food was just okay and the service was slow. When the Colts play many people come from other cities and stay here. The hotel shuttle takes people to the games. Very nice hotel and would recommend it. Stacy - the night manager is great! She has the best customer service skills I have ever seen in a hotel. I will be going back to Indy and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Pricing...Additional Charges WILL APPLY!”
Reviews.Author: spazii
Reviews.Content: I booked a king non-smoking room in September for one night in November 2010. My wife and I arrived late on a Friday night. We thought the hotel was clean and decent, but a little overpriced maybe compared to where we have stayed before. Not a big deal. Upon waking up Saturday morning, I found the bill slid under the door with the charges on it. It had an $18 a night charge for parking. I questioned the front desk manager about it who was...for a lack of better words...rude. I think they should have told me when I booked the room that there was a charge for parking or even Friday night when I checked in. Other than that, I would not classify this hotel "downtown". It is quite a distance from the downtown area. This hotel is on the IUPUI campus. It felt strange driving onto a college campus to stay at this hotel. For a "college hotel", I think this hotel is very overpriced as compared to other college hotels I have seen. Not impressed with the restaurant at the hotel. The gift shop was way overpriced. They were charging $3.00 for a 20 oz. bottle of water. However, the Lucas Oil Stadium charges $3.50. This may be a norm for Indy "downtown". The hotel isn't close to anything, so I guess they think they have you.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: capoxoxxo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. Modern look and was clean. Some rooms needed to fixed. Our remote for the tv did not work and our bathtub did not drain. Things that should be fixed however unless someone complains not easily detected. However the service was friendly and prompt. We purchased through Hotwire. If I paid full price for this hotel I would have been upset. Location was OK but unless you have good weather it is not walking distance to the city stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: AvsGal21
Reviews.Content: The room was nice enough, though we traveled from Chicago and the four star hotels here are much nicer. The biggest problem we had was with the customer service. When we checked in the man behind the desk pulled up our reservation and it was for two twin beds. I had called the week before and asked for a king sized non-smoking and had been told it was no problem -- it was our aniversary. Even though I had called a week earlier the guy behind the desk said he couldn't help us and that we could either keep the room with the two twin beds or pay $50 to upgrade to a suite. We decided to just stay where we were, but it did kind of take the wind out of our sails to know we would either be in one small bed or two seperate ones. I would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, last minute stay”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: Found a good deal, and stayed here 1 night for a Colts game. The major plus is the complimentary shuttle that operates until 1am, which will pick you up and drive you from the hotel to downtown and back (the hotel is a bit far to walk to shopping or sports arenas, especially in cold weather). Our room was clean and functional, though not as modern looking as the hotel's attractive lobby and sitting area. Bathroom was really small and our tub had a slow, clogged drain. Self parking garage is $18/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: wguterbock
Reviews.Content: This hotel and conference center are adjacent to and affiliated with the Indiana University/Purdue campus in Indiana and is next to the IU hospitals. Rooms are large and clean. Flat screen TV and refrigerator in the room. High quality amentites, but the shampoo is too lemony for my taste. Plentiful towels. Well equipped gym with seven or eight cardio machines, weight machine, free weights, and apples to munch on. Our meeting sponsor provided free wireless internet, which was very fast. Conference facilities were excellent and the food was plentiful and superb. Part of the conference area is in a sports museum, which has some interesting exhibits and art works of sports and athletes. Great place for a small or medium sized meeting. I am not sure how big a group they can accomodate.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely difficult to deal with”
Reviews.Author: michskier81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for what I thought was one night. Apparently they felt the need to bill me for 2 nights. I have spent the last 3 days trying to get them to refund me one of the nights but no such luck. I just called for the 4 time and I was hung up on. Currently working with Visa to dispute the charge of the extra night. The hotel itself is nice. The staff is subpar at best, and that'd being nice. Everyone I spoke to exept for one nice lady earlier today was not very pleasant. Indianapolis is a great city and its unfortunate that this hotel has the attitude that it does. There are plenty of other hotels downtown with much nicer staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: pschneid221
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after I read some of the reviews on here... My fears were unfounded. I booked through Priceline and received a great price of $80 for one night. The service was excellent and very professional. The rooms were quite clean and comfortable. I received the 'typical' Priceline room next to the elevators but the sound was very muffled and hardly noticeable. Overall, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Truly kind and considerate staff.”
Reviews.Author: Roseyfinch
Reviews.Content: We didn't plan to stay here, but priceline booked us at a good rate. We found it to be an oasis in the city, large and roomy and attractive with a staff that is naturally kind and accomodating. A free shuttle took us to dinner and picked us up later. They would have taken us anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Highs & Lows”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: Highs: * Great staff * Very clean * Excellent dining Lows: * It's kind of off-the-beaten path. NOTHING nearby that you could walk to for food. I asked an employee and he warned me not to. * Housekeeping was hit-and-miss * I returned after working an event at the State Fair in 111 degree heat...and they don't have a pool.

Reviews.Title: “We were lied to”
Reviews.Author: jwd47905
Reviews.Content: We booked thru priceline, like suggest we called the motel and requested a king no smoking room. when we checked in we were told there were no king rooms left that they were fully booked. I asked, there isnt one king left, they said no, I asked for a queen, what we were given was a room with 2 standard beds. At 10 pm, i called the reservations, I asked if they had any king non smoking rooms they said sure no problem and gave me a rate. The girl that checked me in was not polite and lied to me about the king room not being available. My guess is that since I booked thru priceline, I was given the most inferior room they could find for me. My wife and I ended up sleeping in seperate beds because of the small standard bed size. If this motel doesn't want to enjoy the business from priceline customers, they should simply opt out of the program instead of resorting to lies this is no way to run a motel. We have stayed at some of the finest motels in the world and not gotten this type of treatment. It's just not right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: JulesTravel
Reviews.Content: At first, I was horribly disappointed that this was the hotel my bid on Priceline won. However, in the end, it was our lucky day that we got this hotel a good distance from downtown as there were shootings that occurred in the city centre the night we were there and we would have been right in the crossfire so the fact that we were a good long walk away from the chaos was awesome. Other than the location, I think the hotel is terrific. It was super clean. The room was very nice, good size, new flat panel TVs. We had a great sleep. We did not dine there but the restaurant looked fine and the little sports bar was fantastic to have a end of the night drink as there is virtually nothing around this hotel other than hospital & university. The bathroom [& products] was pleasant, good shower. The hotel is close to the Canal so despite the heat we had a lovely walk back up along the canal from White River Park & Imax Theater. We found a very cool restaurant with great prices & great food on the way back called Bourbon Street - highly recommend this as there are not many options close to the hotel. I think the parking was a bit too high for this location ($18 for self-park/$24 for valet) but at least our car was safely parked underground in a secure lot for that price. I also thought the normal room rate was way too high for this "out of the way" location but the Priceline price made it sweet. The lack of swimming pool was a huge disappointment for a 4* hotel. As far as the shuttle, we were told it would take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius. Absolutely NOT TRUE. The driver would only take us to the corner of Washington & Capital. Said that was the ONLY drop-off point. Normally, would not have been an issue ... but it was 94' and humid so having to walk those extra 4 blocks just seemed annoying when she could have easily dropped us where we wanted to go. All in all we totally enjoyed our stay at this hotel. However, I don't think it's fair to classify this hotel on Priceline as "downtown" ... but that's the luck of the draw on PL ... it's always the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet, and very...”
Reviews.Author: FCLymond
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, quiet, and very convenient to IU Medical Center and IUPUI. Definitely will return when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Rather expensive for an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyl33t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at University Place for the 2010 Mini Marathon. I am a resident of Indianapolis and graduate of IUPUI where the hotel is located, so my perspective is less as a tourist/visitor and more as simply a patron. The hotel itself is very nice looking and clean. The rooms were clean and modern. We had a view facing downtown, which was cool. There's free wifi that was workable, and a free shuttle to downtown (which only runs until 11pm). All the staff we encountered were nice enough. We parked in the garage and spent $18 on overnight parking, which is a lot to be paying for a hotel not central to downtown, but oh well. It was kind of crappy because for self parking, we had to park, drag our stuff up to check in, then go back down to the garage to put a permit on our car, and nobody bothered to tell us what exactly we needed to bring with us for in and out privileges (bring the hang tag AND blue ticket). We took the shuttle into downtown to go to the convention center, and were given a number to call for pickup. When we called and arranged a pickup later, we were told it'd be 5-10 minutes. After waiting 25 minutes on a street corner at night, we decided to just take a cab back to the hotel. The beds aren't comfortable, and the rooms are on the chilly side, making for a blah night's sleep. The hotel was doing shuttle service early to the middle of downtown for the mini marathon, which was nice. There is no breakfast included with your room, and the concierge had no idea what the price range for the breakfast was in the restaurant, so we picked up snacks at speedway and put them in the room's refrigerator. Overall, it was a decent hotel. The distance from downtown isn't really all that bad, though I feel like this should be a much cheaper hotel because of that. The proximity of the hotel from the mini start makes it a decent choices for the race if you happen to get it on Hotwire, but otherwise I'd definitely stay in a hotel that actually is downtown for a similar or cheaper price (like the Holiday Inn Express, or even the Sheraton). This hotel claims to be 5 stars, but it really doesn't have the amenities to compare to most other downtown hotels. I don't think I'd stay here again unless I had business on IUPUI campus or in the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “terribly managed front desk”
Reviews.Author: Tennislady
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers who have experienced hospitality across North America and abroad.This hotel is not convenient to the convention center, if you are planning to walk in business attire. It is fine if you have tennis shoes, comfortable walking shoes and time. There are many hotels right in downtown near the convention center that are much more practical . That being said , University Place is a updated, contemporary hotel connected to the hospital.It is in a very clean, quiet area.Upon our arrival and throughout our stay,the valets were very nice and accommodating. The front desk was almost always understaffed (only one person )and very unknowledgeable about their city. They had "never heard of..." areas of town or restaurants that we inquired about.They are in dire need of training workshops and should not be working in the hospitality/ tourism industry until they know about their city !!!! Our room was nice, but the bathroom was tiny . The huge door to the bathroom opened into the bathroom creating an even smaller space. A pocket door would have made a huge difference. Housekeeping was prompt and good. The exercise room was out of water in the cooler for 2 of the days that we exercised.The coffee shop was opened very few hours in the morning ,but would close during those few hours for the attendants breaks !!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, though it's not truly downtown”
Reviews.Author: enabler
Reviews.Content: Like several here, won this on Priceline as a 4 star downtown hotel. I don't know how many visitors would consider this actually downtown, but I don't. It's close and they do provide a free roundtrip shuttle (remember to tip the driver), but it's not the same level of convenience. If you have business at IUPUI or one of the hospitals on campus, you can't beat it. Front desk employees were helpful and the room was better than expected, with VERY comfortable beds and free internet. The only other downer for University Place is the $14/day parking, cheaper than the true downtown hotels, but still too much for where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Not Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Travis54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok. It is not downtown. This hotel is not a 4-star like many websites claim it is. I would probaly rate it a 3-star. No pool. On the plus side there is a free shutle that will take you to or pick you up from downtown. Also parking is very expensive considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nstojov
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here. First time I thought it was ok, except my blankets and pillows smelled like men's cologne...gross! I thought I'd give it another shot. This time it was more disappointing. When I checked into my room it was dirty. There was toilet paper on the floor, the towels were scattered throughout the bathroom, and the sink was a mess. I immediately asked for a different room. The second room was better, but still did not have the clean feel to it, as the bathroom counter just looked as though it hadn't been wiped down in a while. Later in my stay I found garbage under the desk. They do not clean well at all. It really grossed me out and I will not stay here again. Oh, and the service at the bar/grill was extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “Try and make the best of it! Priceline trap”
Reviews.Author: winks1996
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel as a 5 star, downtown indy hotel on priceline. The problem is it is not a 5 star and its not downtown. With that being said I would say it's a 3 star and around a mile from the good activities of downtown. I would say its not a bad walk to the canal area and state park, if the weather was good. The hotel is remodeled, contemporary and overall nice. The staff is alright the rooms were adequate and clean. They have an air freshner in the air ducts that smells good but can be a litttle much. To get downtown they have a free shuttle that makes stops along a route and if not busy can take you to specific destinations, which we did. We were taken to Bazbeau's pizza on Mass. st. and I had no clue on how to get there so having a shuttle was actually nice. When you are done they give you a card with a number to call and tell them you are ready to be picked up.Each time we were picked up quickly. There are signs reminding you to tip the driver and I did as I felt he did a good job, so the shuttle actually is not totally free. Bottom line I would never make reservations at the University Place other than business at IUPUI, but if I bid on priceline again I am bidding LOW to make up for this locations downfalls, and to offset the inconvienences with a super cheap price. More than likely when we go back I will pay full price for a hotel that is actually downtown. Also no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy with this hotel - should have slept in my car!!!”
Reviews.Author: qwrtz4321
Reviews.Content: Horrible service, room was very dirty with a horrible smell - we could never figure out the source of the stinch.

Reviews.Title: “better days”
Reviews.Author: bluebird4u
Reviews.Content: it was convenient in that it was connected to the hopsital where my dad was staying when he had to have his bladder removed due to cancer. so i wasnt paying much attention to the surroundings but i do remember the rooms seemed to have a stale odor. it also seemed dreary and dark and the shower curtain appeared to have been around since its invention...whenever that was. the lack of water pressure was such that i thought my hair would never again be free of conditioner. i had a beautiful view of a roof top...the rocky gravel was mesmerizing and thought provoking. Other than that...it was fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy, clean, and great quality”
Reviews.Author: IndyFan500
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before the Kenny Chesey concert and check-in was a breeze. We checked in 2 hours before the normal check-in time and our room was available. We also learned upon check-in that they had a shuttle to and from Downtown that made it more convenient than buying a cab. The rooms were really nice and everyone was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: TimEbert
Reviews.Content: This is advertised as a AAA 4 diamond resort. I am sure it was at one time. The room was confortable, close to perfect. To me perfect is a thermostat, confortable linens, updated entertainment/room furniture. This was the case. However, the walls were thin- the restaurants were closed- (bar food only for lunch one day), some things in the room were in disrepair, and the parking was a challenge. Excellent choice if you have business with the University. Poor choice if you are looking for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location”
Reviews.Author: DonO70
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Priceline and wanted a room downtown. It is downtown if you consider that is 1 1/4 miles to center of downtown. Also, not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location if you are interested in downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: stephenkg
Reviews.Content: This is a remote location nowhere near downtown Indianapolis. Although they have a free shuttle, it stops running at 11 p.m. There is nothing of interest in walking distance unless you are here for the university. This hotel has no hot tub or swimming pool. The gym is barely adequate with old equipment and has no showers. The service was excellent. Staff were pleasant and went out of their way to say "hello" or "good evening." Free fresh fruit at check in and in the gym are a nice touch. The free wi-fi is great as well. My room was wonderfully decorated with comfortable furnishings and lots of outlets. However, the building is showing signs of wear. The elevators shutter, shake, jolt and make horrible noises. Some of the walls in the hallways need to be resurfaced/repainted. Parking is overpriced at $14. a day. I discovered (too late) there was free street parking right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but loud”
Reviews.Author: SheenaBeana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, but we could hear everyone that walked by our door. We stayed on the tenth floor and I noticed there was quite a large gap between the floor and the bottom of thr door. We were awaken at 6:00am to kids running down the hall and people having conversations. The bathroom was rather small but other than that it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: phillygir32
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first ever trip to Indy for the Indy 500. The hotel is very nice, clean comfortabel and modern. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful during our three nights there. Downtown is a 15 min walk but if you don't feel like walking there is a free shuttle that will take you anytime and pick you up when you call them.
