When we arrived at the airport for our flight home, I realized I had left my cell phone in the hotel room. Panicked that I wouldn't get it back (it's the fancy Iphone that I was convinced the staff would steal), I immediately called the hotel from the airport. They located the phone and mailed it back to me in Philadelphia within less than 24 hours free of charge!! They were wonderful! I highly, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant change from downtown hotels!”
Reviews.Author: mnl10221982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the University Place hotel while we were in Indianapolis visiting friends. Although we generally stay downtown due to the convenience of being able to walk everywhere we go, we aren't fans of the noise downtown on the weekends so we decided to try something new. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was impressed with the appearance of the interior. Everything was fresh, modern, and very colorful. It was a very comfortable environment. The staff was friendly and the lobby had plenty of areas where a group could sit to socialize. It was fairly late when we got there, so we went straight to our room. The room was also very clean and modern. It did not seem like a hotel room. The beds were comfortable and the linens were plush and adequate. There was plenty of room to set up our 17 month old son's pack 'n' play and a fridge with plenty of space for storing his milk and juice. The bathroom was small but the colorful shower curtain was a nice touch. There were plenty of soft towels and wash cloths. The water pressure was adjustable. The complimentary toiletries were earth friendly - no plastic bottles. We ordered breakfast from room service. While it was a bit pricey for breakfast, it was delicious and convenient. My husband and I both ordered made to order omelets which came with breakfast potatoes, toast, juice, and coffee or tea and we ordered a banana, scrambled eggs, and bacon for our son. It was much easier to take our time to eat in the room. Breakfast was delivered right on time and it was HOT! We utilized the express checkout via the television in our room which was quick and easy. In all, our stay was very enjoyable and we will consider this hotel for future trips to Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Guys, Impress Your Partner With Your Choice Of Hotel...Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: justthatgoodguyjim
Reviews.Content: It's not easy being a maintenance man in love with a high maintenance woman. But I scored some points staying here AND saving some $$ by going through a internet discount site. The place was clean and the front desk staff was helpful. While the hotel is on the campus of IUPUI, the heart of downtown was only 1 mile away. The room was quite large and the king size bed was firm the way we like it. There was a fridge in the room that kept the Spumante chilled while we were enjoying the Indiana chill. The bathroom was large...not like at a discount place. A full bath was large enough for two to shower comfortably...if you know what I mean ;) We tried the downstairs restaurant for breakfast. We opted for the buffet which was adequate. I'd book here again. My partner's expectations regarding my travel choices is up which is more than I can say about the economy. Stay here and be a winner either way!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgous hotel and awsome view from our room!”
Reviews.Author: jbjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel threw a discount travel site and we got a great deal, but it did say that we were staying downtown...not really downtown. They do provide a shuttle service, it makes several stops, better just to get a cab ($7 to downtown) Parking was a little salty as well garage was $14, valet was $20! The Hotel was very nicely decorated and the rooms were outstanding!!! A really nice view topped it all off!

Reviews.Title: “Great access to the University”
Reviews.Author: Renaissance_Anna
Reviews.Content: University Place was a great deal on Expedia, when I booked about 2 months ahead of time. I would not have paid full price, but it's a bargain for the area if you can get a deal under $100. I was attending a seminar at the University, and there was easy access to the business school buildings through a skybridge from the conference center - very nice when it snowed! The rooms were very nice, with a bit of wear and tear in the bathroom. Internet access worked perfectly, temperature control was great, had a nice view of downtown from the 8th floor. We tried both the on-site restaurants, which share a kitchen and bar. The sports bar had good food and a great bartender, who remembered us on subsequent visits! The upscale restaurant (Chancellor's) had pretty good food and a fairly nice atmosphere, but the service was mediocre. Had a nice time, and recommend it if you can get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler22
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my short stay at the University Place Conference Centre Hotel. Its location is fantastic as I was doing business at the university hospital. There is a huge Barnes and Noble accross de street. I believe the hotel is a little pricey becasue of its corporate and business focus. I wouldn't recommend it for families with kids. Rooms are spacious and clean. I actually ordered room service and it was very good. The whole complex building is fairly new. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel because of the Service”
Reviews.Author: cheerioh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel: Very clean, very modern Check in/out: Extremely quick and efficient. Gave us all the information needed to make our stay and exit comfortable Free: Shuttle to downtown, internet, fruit flavored iced water in lobby, fruit (pears, fuji apples) in lobby Parking: $14 Room: Clean, Modern, Aveda products, Free safe, Beds are slightly firm, but nothing you can't sleep in, cribs available at no charge. Were given a "city view" upgrade when there were no more king rooms available. A nice view and gesture. Breakfast Buffet $14: made to order omelets, and all the regulars Service: We came to watch the Colts. Last minute we thought we needed emergency babysitting for our 10 month old (the website states that all persons regardless of age require a ticket and we didn't think we could acquire one an hour before the start of the game for her). When we called the hotel front desk, the lovely person after unsuccessfully finding babysitting actually offered to watch our child for us so we could go. In the end, we found a ticket, but the gesture was amazing. That was the extreme of awesome service. Every single employee was as hospitable. Housekeeping promptly brought up a freshly made crib, extra toiletries. The shuttle drivers made getting to the game easy - and though we walked back - there were lots who just took the shuttle back home. The restaurant staff were quick and courteous. Even the guest services lady who came to tell us we were late for our check out (which is at 11, NOT 12) was kind. Overall: If were able to come back for a Colts game in our future, we would definitely stay here again. We got the room for $54 on Priceline, but to ensure we got this hotel, we would consider just paying the regular website price. And if you are like us, hoping you didn't get a bum hotel off Priceline, you didn't. You will have an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm....”
Reviews.Author: GreenKalit
Reviews.Content: I packed an air mattress because the hotel could not guarantee the room type we selected for our business trip. When we arrived we were surprised by the quality of the hotel, very nice standard conference hotel. Modern fixings nice beds. Only a mile out of downtown. There is a shuttle to downtown which they don't tell you. So overall nice hotel with really disorganized service. The other hotels across from the conference center are extremely well done, but $100 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: li2s1a7
Reviews.Content: My husband and children recently stayed here for two nights, booked via priceline for a very good price. The hotel is very nice and modern with large rooms however the beds are extremely uncomfortable. The mattresses are very very firm and the sheets are 100% polyester. Because of that I was not able to get a good night's sleep either night. My husband however slept fine, because he doesn't mind sleeping on what felt like a slab of concrete and sandpaper for sheets. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: niki032
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, so were very unsure about what we were going to get. When we got to the hotel we were very pleasantly suprised. The hotel building is very new and the staff is very nice. The parking garage attached to the hotel is very convenient. The room was large and clean. Everything in the room was very new and modern, which is very different from what you get at other hotels. It is conveniently located to downtown. It only took a couple of minutes to drive there. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: jmzl1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was more than we expected overall. Hotel & room decor was lovely. It was nice from the usual hotel ambience you get at most places. Everything from the curtains to the carpet was different (in a good way). Rooms were kept very clean. Our only one complaint is the bed sheets. They were too, too crisp and weren't that comfortable. (the thread count was only 250). But once you're asleep, you don't think about it I guess. I will probably stay here again if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MotoGPMan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice but just some minor issues. The bed stinks. Both my wife and I came back from this hotel and our backs were killing us. Didn't sleep well the whole time there due to uncomfortable bed. The linens were clean and crisp but the matress is horrible. Liked the flat panel TV and hotel restaurant food was good. If you stay here and need something outside the hotel to eat just head east on University and you'll find Noddles and Company,Taco Bell, Au Bon Pain and few other restaurants. All in all a nice stay of course except for the mattress

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: doormold
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, not directly downtown but you can be there in five minutes via automobile. Heck, you could even walk if so inclined. The room was nicely appointed and the bed was to die for…big comfy mattress and blankets. There was plenty of work space and the free Wi-Fi was a plus. The hotel has a coffee shop, good for a quick breakfast buffet. The gourmet dinner restaurant is always closed on the weekend, so that was a bit of a bummer. A free shuttle took us to the tourist spots and there are quite a few close to the hotel. The only drawback was the $14/day to park…this fee was not disclosed in the HOTWIRE confirmation. Our biggest delight was paying $68/night via HOTWIRE on a room that the hotel itself listed at $169/night. Overall, an excellent hotel…we would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1CrazyCanuck
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I used Priceline to book a hotel and had studied and read up on the pros & cons etc. So quite honestly I was pretty disappointed when I saw my bid accepted and the hotel won being the University Place Hotel; since I didn't know much about the hotel and read some reviews on it I guess I had a bit of a bias. I was so disppointed that I tried to change the reservation through priceline of course to no avail; so I accepted the situation and looked on the bright side that I got a REALLY GREAT RATE on a 4* ranked hotel. But after a two nights stay this past weekend WOW I gotta say that I wasted my time in trying to change the reservation; this hotel lives up to the 4* ranking. Room Value: The rate through priceline was AMAZING! Staff: Super friendly and went out of their way to make my wife, my baby daughter's and my stay very pleasant and helped with various special requests. Ammenities: Yes there is no pool on-site so if you use priceline to book thats the risk you take! The free shuttle was a great treat, the drivers were very friendly and as long as we asked ahead of time how long it would take for a pick-up our expectations were met. The free wi-fi access was a nice treat, was able to stay connected through the weekend. Didn't eat much in the hotel but did have one breakfast at the buffet in the hotel, great great selection for $13 (made to order omelets, pancakes, bacon, hashbrowns, sausages, porridge, fresh fruit, cereals, various breads muffins etc.). Room: Very clean, the king bed was very soft and for some reason even with me, my wife and our baby on the bed it felt like it was king kong sized bed rather than just a king. The flat-screen tv was a nice addition to the room. Very updated decor! Bathroom: Great bathroom products like the oatmeal soap; bright & clean! Now note that this hotel is not in the core downtown area but is within easy walking distance of it, we enjoyed on one of the nights a great stroll from the Old Spaghetti Factory through White River Snake Park, the canal and to the hotel. Felt competely safe the whole time. In fact in the downtown core I noticed some panhandlers but no problem with that near the university grounds. I assume that once school starts that whole area becomes even more livelier! By the way yes there is a parking charge but so do most of the hotels in the area. In the end the only disappointment was deciding to stay some extra nights and realizing that priceline couldn't give us the same rate, so we decided to cut the stay at the hotel short. Great hotel in a great city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 4 Star quality”
Reviews.Author: BandBCuties
Reviews.Content: This hotel had both good and bad points. First the good points. The staff was courteous, the decor was modern and updated, the parking was convenient, and the price through priceline was appropriate. The bad points would be the moldy shower curtain and hair in the tub, the elevators were a little shakey, and drinks at the sports bar should be avoided. We ordered a Margarita with Patron and received what we consider a horrible Seven and Seven. Overall a decent place to stay but not quite 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: BSuny
Reviews.Content: Service is terrible and air conditioning did not work. They lied to keep me from going to another hotel when I went to the room and discoved they had no A/C. I found out later they had told others that the problem would be fixed shortly - however it had not been remedied in days. I had to keep my door open to the hallway as the windows do not open as well. It must have been 105 degrees in my room! Parking is expensive, and the advertised pool is part of the university and closes early. Bathrooms are much nicer in a Hampton or Holiday Inn Express. The service was aweful and a manager was no where to be found after 2 days of requests. I wouldn't stay here again, and they should definately not be a 4 star rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: khobgood
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect a whole lot with a hotel with this name but it was definitely a 4* hotel as described. Very contemporary lobby and beautiful rooms with flat screen televisions, wonderful beds, linens, etc. The $12 parking was little high, but this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star at best”
Reviews.Author: robert70808
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not close to 4 star standards. The elevators are in disrepair, the maid service is sketchy, and they missed a requested wake-up call and acted as if I never requested it rather than apologize. You can do much, much better in the downtown area of Indianapolis for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: teamstumbo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 5 night rendevous with my husband. He is in the military and was training at nearby Camp Atterbury. It was our last time together before he deployed overseas so I wanted a place that was nice and University Place was. The front desk staff was very friendly, prompt and curtious. The hotel was tastefully decorated and the rooms were very well appointed...reminded me of a room you might find at the Hyatt or Sheraton. The bed was also extrememly comfortable. Our stay happened to be during the NFL kickoff weekend so there was a lot going on downtown and we were a little far from the action. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle but it wasn't the most convenient. There is also a University shuttlebus parked right across the street that we used a few times. Actually, we walked to and from downtown quite a bit. My husband and I are in good shape and the 2 mile walk was good exercise (although I wasn't wearing the best of shoes!) The hotel had two nice restuarants (one was a bar/grill type place and the other was a little nicer). The food and atmosphere in both was great. There was also a Subway and pizza shop that was connected to the complex. All in all, we had a wonderful time at this hotel. Although, since I hadn't seen my other in half in about 2 mos we could have been at a Motel 6 and I would have been happy....I'm just waiting for him to come home so we can have a real vacation...this time we're on the Hawaii for a week!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: ddinsmore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is configured in a U shape, with one wing being the meeting spaces (above ground with windows!) and the other wing being the sleeping rooms. Lovely courtyard with benches, although it was too cold to enjoy on this trip. Several restaurants, one with a breakfast buffet. The lobby color scheme was unusual, a modern flair with bright colors, but I liked it. The rooms have recently been redone, with dark woods and new electronics. Refrigerator in the room was a nice touch. The bathroom could have been cleaner, and the cable selection was very limited. Parking was next door for $14. Easy access to downtown and our meeting location. Unbeatable deal on priceline, not sure I'd pay the full rate though.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Priceline - This hotel IS NOT downtown and NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: BadLizard
Reviews.Content: For the second time I got stuck at this hotel which IS NOT downtown. You can see downtown, but that is it. It is also a stretch for them to consider this a 4 star hotel. Maybe a 3 1/2 but closer to a 3. I suspect they give it this rating simply because they have conference facilities. There isn't even a pool or hot tub. There are NO snack vending machines and no place within walking distance to get any snacks after the gift shop closes early. If you are going to be close to the college then you will like this place. If you are a business traveler like myself you will be sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: cprussel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the University Place Hotel for two nights during the Big Ten basketball tournament. This is a nice hotel. Very clean. The rooms are large and very modern and updated. The rooms have a large flat panel television. Large clean bathrooms. A shuttle is provided for access to downtown and is prompt for pickup and drop off. On site restaurants are nice. Overall a very good hotel experience. Staff very professional. This hotel is not within short walking distance of downtown hotspots, but with shuttle it is really not an issue,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the Downtown area”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: The University Place Hotel is a wonderful facility that deserves a shot at your travel money. I stayed in a King Bed, Nonsmoking room that was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room had a refrigerator and a flat screen plasma television. I booked through priceline.com and got an excellent rate on the room for the night ($60). I did have to pay another $14 for parking in the adjacent garage. It is a plus that you can get from the garage to the hotel without going outside. The location is a bit too far from downtown Indianapolis to walk, but the hotel offers a free shuttle to the downtown area. I did not take the shuttle service but was impressed that they offer it as a complimentary amenity. I have only a few criticisms - the bathroom is pretty tiny and the shower head didn't have much pressure or a lot of water output. But the bath amenities were nice. There was a very large conference in the hotel at the time but it did not affect my stay in any way - no extra noise or anything that inconvenienced my check-in or check-out. Whenever I return to Indianapolis, I will definitely consider another stay at University Place.

Reviews.Title: “Slow service, but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is isolated from downtown but is the best place to stay if you have university business. It is directly connected to the SPEA/Business School building via covered walkways. My room cost $135 plus tax at regular rates (you can do better online, but the university was paying for mine). The hotel has a free shuttle (the drivers ask for a tip) that will take you anywhere within a three miles radius, very convenient for a downtown dinner. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are very comfortable, with two exceptions: my room had an annoyingly strong fragrance left behind by the cleaners (hard on those of us with perfume allergies). I also stayed on the 9th floor near the exercise facilities, and was awakened at 11 p.m. by the thump-thump-thump of an exercise machine (at first I thought it was something else, ahem.... ). The food is quite good -- a bistro, a restaurant and a food court (the latter only available when classes are in session). Be sure to try the Bistro's Mediterranean Flat Bread Salad with grilled Ahi Tuna! The breakfast buffet is $9.00 for the Continental, or a little more for the full buffet -- a good value for what you get, although the pastries were pathetic! Besides the perfumes and my allergies, the only problem I had during two recent stays here was with the excrutiatingly slow service by hotel personnel. I phoned one night for room service (about 8 p.m., during spring break) and I never got an answer. So I called guest services -- still no answer. Finally, after ten minutes, my third call to the last button on my phone -- the front desk -- was answered. The hotel should be embarrassed by such casual service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: hungry_indy_guy
Reviews.Content: I sent a note to the manager to thank them for their great service: "Thank you so much for helping us book a room for a patient's mother at IU Hospital. You were very professional and accommodating. When [patient's mother] came to check in on Sunday night, my wife and I were very pleased at the tastefully appointed room. Compared to sleeping in a chair in a hospital room which she had done for 3 nights, I have no doubt that you gave a restoring night's sleep to a mother who's son is in a losing battle in intensive care across the street. Your courtesy and extra-mile service are very appreciated. Please let your superiors know how excellent you are and what an amazing asset you are to UPCC&H. "This has been our first experience with your hotel and it is beautiful, clean, even snazzy. We would gladly recommend it to anyone coming in to town. "Thanks again!"

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCJohnny1
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay- plush bed, huge rooms, great stuff in the bathrooms. I also got this on Priceline and this place is not downtown, but that was fine by me. Parking was $14/night and I'm not sure if the internet was free or not because I couldn't figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly downtown Indy, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MGreulich
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read the other reviews before booking on Priceline because I had the same experience --- asked for a 4 star hotel in downtown Indy, and this is what I got. But, for $60 it was an okay deal except for location. As for the hotel, it is very nice for a campus location. The room was spacious with a very comfortable bed, great flat screen TV, chair and ottoman, desk, and a nice bathroom. We didn't eat at the restaurants, but they were available. There is a free shuttle downtown, but we ended up taking a cab so we wouldn't have to wait -- we waited for about 5-6 minutes and got antzy. Others were waiting longer. The cab was just $5. There would have been a fee of $14 a night to park, but when we left on Sunday the gate was open so we didn't have to pay. As we were leaving we stopped at the front desk to ask if we would have to pay cash, and they gave us a voucher so parking would be on the house-- a very nice gesture but not needed when the gate was open. All in all, a good hotel if you are going to stay on campus, but I would not recommend staying here if you planned to spend a weekend in the city unless there is nothing else available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel BUT BEWARE WITH PRICELINE”
Reviews.Author: knichols
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline after seeing what I thought were ALL the four star hotels and what I thought was DOWNTOWN Indianapolis. However, this is what I got. No complaints with the hotel but it is not within walking distance of downtown. Priceline needs to do a little better advertising if they want repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Can be a Great value if you get the right price!”
Reviews.Author: steeeeevo
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we used Priceline. We were disappointed that Priceline considered this downtown Indy. Not exactly. But for $60 a night, it was a steal. The lobby was gorgeous. Beautiful fresh flowers, very friendly staff. The rooms were equally as nice. Very modern. As we were vacationing and staying for just a couple nights, we were very frustrated when we arrived to find an hour-long line in the lobby waiting to check in. Apparently we hit right as a large conference group was arriving. We pleaded our case with the lady at the desk and were upgraded to the PRESIDENTIAL SUITE. Talk about a sweet deal for $60 a night! Normally $600 we hear. So why not 5/5? Because I wouldn't pay full price for a room here. The hotel itself was probably worthy, but the location was lacking. It was on the campus of a university. Not within walking distance of anything worthwhile. It was attached to a weird food court wannabe in which most of the restaraunts looked closed down. There was a nice looking restaraunt/bar in the hotel but we didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsiderate!”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier1961
Reviews.Content: I was planning a surprise for my husband-just the two of us- a little getaway after Christmas shopping. Booked a night at University Place because it was close to the downtown area. However, the forcast a few days after booking called for a blizzard! Knowing we could not keep the reservation I called the hotel hoping to change the date of our stay. Since I booked online and had pre-paid, the reservationist said there was nothing I could do. Her manager had instructed her not to help anyone who wanted to cancel because of the weather. Conveniently the manager had left the hotel not to return until Monday at 10 AM. Of course, he would not want to be caught out in 17 inches of snow! So much for the Christmas spirit. If this is customer service, then these people should get coal in their stockings!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference facility”
Reviews.Author: njpmg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to attend a meeting. Very impressive facility! The room was really spacious, clean, and the decor was modern. The flat-screen tv was a bonus although the reception was touch-and-go. The bathroom was a little small, and even though they updated the vanity (granite) and had awesome toiletries (Molton Brown), the walls, toilet, and tub also need updating. I really appreciated the computer and printer in the lobby for customers to check their flights and print out boarding passes. The restaurant was pretty good and reasonably priced for dinner. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LT2013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is on the campus of the medical center where we had an appointment. The staff was delightful, the housekeeping was absolutely outstanding everywhere we looked, everything was spotless and in good condition. Our room had 2 superbly comfortable beds with lush bedding. Large plasma screen TV, large desk area, well equipped closet with excellent hangers of different types, extra pillow (each bed had 4), plenty of big, very nice towels (at least 4 full sets of towels, maybe 5). We ate in the hotel several times and it was excellent and very nicely decorated in both the casual restaurant and the nicer one (Chancellor's). Food was very nice, staff was excellent, and the glassware/dishes/cutlery were very nice (and spotless clean). The floral decorations in the lobby are stunning. Free WSJ, local paper and USA Today in lobby; USA Today under your door each morning. I would rank this close to the Starwood category. We stay in many hotels and this one is definitely an unusually good value for a very modest price. The manager and staff of this hotel deserve accolades.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: DiverDrew
Reviews.Content: Got a great weekend deal via Priceline. Was at first hesitant as the hotel is not exactly down town, but soon realized that they have a free shuttle and the cab fare to most central downtown locations is less than $5. Room was fine. No noise problems. Super comfortable beds. Check-in was a 4pm with no flexibility. So we stayed in the nice hotel bar for 45 minutes (great wings), nice bartender. We were just there for an overnight stay and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: aprille
Reviews.Content: I just got back today from a two-night stay at the University Place Conference Center & Hotel (I was attending a conference). My work requires me to stay at university hotels of this type fairly often, and this was definitely one of the best of its ilk. It was very convenient, since my conference facilities were on site, and the shuttle to downtown was quick and reliable (free, but tipping is encouraged). The rooms and lobby areas were very nicely decorated in a warm but modern style. Every staffperson I interacted with, from the people at the check-in desk to custodial workers, was friendly and professional. I ate food provided by the hotel catering service, and it was good but unremarkable. I think the actual restaurant would probably be better, but I didn't eat there. Some of my colleagues enjoyed the sports bar. The room was spacious, clean, and very well-appointed. Some of my colleagues said their beds were too firm, but I thought mine was very comfortable (and I'm not one who prefers a super-hard mattress, either). The toiletries were of nice quality, and there was an ionic hairdryer, which was a pleasant surprise. I can only think of two negatives: the tub/shower was kind of worn and could use replacement. Also, it is a bit far from downtown if you're looking to do things there (though the shuttle is convenient, and it's also walkable, though a long walk). I would definitely stay there again. It would be a great choice for a person or family visiting campus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jules610
Reviews.Content: Got this room through Priceline for $55 - was a bit disappointed that we had to pay $14 to park. Nice decor, bed was very comfortable and flat screen tv was great. I agree with some of the other reviews regarding the noise- we could hear very clearly people talking in the hallway. Would stay here again - although quite a distance to the heart of downtown - ( they do have a free shuttle)

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it's ok”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: This hotel comes up on Priceline often. I was at first a bit annoyed because I really wanted the Hyatt, but in the end, I was happy with this hotel. First, the good part. The rooms and lobby are very nice. Rooms are spacious with a flatscreen panel tv and Molton Brown toiletries, which impressed me. The bed is very comfortable and free wifi or wired internet is offered all over the hotel. There is alos a hotel shuttle that will take you anywhere downtown. The bad part: service is remedial here. The front desk agents are a little rude and have a bit of an attitude. Check out time is a ridiculous 11AM, and it's a huge favor if you ask for even 12 noon, which I always thought was the standard. The bellman is never at his desk, and no one helps you to open the doors when you're arriving with your luggage. I think the bellman is out driving the shuttle, usually. So they just need to hire another one. And finally, don't bother with breakfast there. Go downtown. Breakfast is awful there and very slow. I actually ordered a continental breakfast for room service, and instead of 10-15 minutes, it took 30 minutes. How hard is it to put a danish on a plate and pour coffee into a pot? The room service waiter at least apologized and said she got tied up, but she should have called to notify me that she would be late. Also, I had to call the restaurant directly for room service. I called the dedicated "Room Service" line over the course of 10 minutes, and no one ever picked up. Housekeeping could use an improvement too. But, all in all, it was a short stay, and I only paid $52/night + tax, so it was good for the price. Just one more note: this hotel is in the middle of the university and not really downtown. But it's a short cab ride to downtown or take the free hotel or city shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: I was mad after I got this hotel on priceline. I did not look at their map of downtown Indianapolis. I assumed they meant downtown not a mile from downtown. None the less it was my fault. I was not happy paying 14 dollars to park. I found out later that If I had waited until after 10 pm on saturday night I could have parked for free all day sunday. At least the red line is free to downtown except for sundays. The shuttle is also free. The hotel itself is very nice and well kept. Free internet in room and a free computer in the lobby. A 4 star hotel for sure. The bedding was awesome. A very good night sleep. The flat screen tv was very nice. The fridge in the room was plus. The view was great. The bathroom was very nice as well. Another bonus is the food court past the lobby. It made for good food at a reasonable price. The down side to the hotel. Sound proofing could have been better. We had the misfortune of hearing the activities from 2 doors down. Also avoid buying anything from the gift shop. I paid 2 dollars for a bar of soap and 4 dollars for a toothe brush. The staff was awesome. Friendly and helpful. No complaints in that area at all.

Reviews.Title: “My husband did well!”
Reviews.Author: Springbreakers2
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel for us, part of week long family vacation thru Indiana. Very enjoyable stay! Lovely rooms, courteous staff, good location. Having a shuttle for quests is great feature. My school-age sons enjoyed it, also. Very good hot breakfast bar every morning is convenient, relaxing, & pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the rate”
Reviews.Author: SpringfieldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend. Got on priceline bid for $65. The place was well maintained. Requested a corner room for two windows and it was not disappointing at all. Good views (Rm# 934) well maintained room. Flat screen TV is a novelty. Pictures posted in all webstites are exactly how the room looks. Friendly staff. Dowtown shuttle was good but only till 11:00 PM. Did not try their food so cannot comment. WIRELESS INTERNET FREE ALL OVER. Things against this hotel are: Possibly 3.5 star upscale as the old (prerenovation) remanants show (like hallways, doors, door knobs etc.) Bathroom small $14 parking fees! Totally not warranted NOT IN DOWNTOWN The shuttle is only 5 min to downtown but not convinient when you are there only to go around in downtown (tourism) If bidding for this hotel try $55 as others have got it for this price. THIN walls. Could hear everything next room

Reviews.Title: “Great room cheap...”
Reviews.Author: TeamW
Reviews.Content: After looking for a room in Indy for a couple of nights in the 4-star range, we concluded we were going to have to pay $130+ a night. My wife, apparently because Willy Shatner told her to, fired up Priceline.com and got a room for $65 nightly. I was scared she had bought us 2 nights in a no-tell motel, the ghetto, etc. Boy was I surprised. Our check in was a breeze. The decor of the lobby was neat-o. Our room, on the top floor, had a great view of the skyline. The room was spacious. The decoration was contemporary. Everything was better than average. The furnishings, bed linens, TV (plasma screen, baby), and bed were something we would expect in a room at twice the price. The only draw back to the hotel is its location. It's about 6 or so blocks from downtown in the middle of a college campus. There is literally nothing to do outside of the hotel. Unless there is an event at the hotel, the place is largely uninhabited. The free shuttle service the hotel provided was great. Parking was free. This almost made up for the remote location. Because of the location, as is against my better judgment, we tried the restaurant in the hotel. Again, I was pleasantly surprised. Though a little pricey, our meals were superb. If I ever had to return to Indy, this would be my choice of places to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel-Great Price”
Reviews.Author: smc21
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel! The front desk was very polite and helpful. The interior is very contemporary and stylish. Our room was a good size. It looked just like the pictures on the internet. We had a flat screen tv with a very clear picture. We also had a good view of the surounding area. At $76/night on Hotwire, we wished we could have stayed longer. The hotel lets you use the university's ammenities. It also offers a free shuttle to downtown. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Brewctred
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on 4/21. $55/night through priceline.com. The room was a little on the small side (2 adults and 1 child), but beautifully decorated......lush is the word that best describes the decor. Flat panel television, curtains close completely so NO sun comes in, great Moulton Brown bathroom products, excellent shower pressure, fluffy, large towels, and the best bed I've sleep in in a long time. Parking is free and underground, and there is a shuttle that will take you anywhere downtown and pick you up. Hated to leave, but we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: kljdzb
Reviews.Content: Free transportation to the downtown area is extremely convenient! Anyone interested in museum-hopping and canal-walking should definately stay here, as it is within walking distance to many places of interest. The hotel has multiple places to eat, provides a 24-hour fitness center and free fruit in the fitness center and at the front desk. Fabulous decor and helpful, friendly staff, plus the fact that the hotel is located on the lovely IUPUI campus (which is smoke-free, a positive factor for those of us who don't smoke) make this my top choice of places to stay in the clean and beautiful city of Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4star/disappointed/stay downtown proper for convenience”
Reviews.Author: SweetCincy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at University Place Conference Center & Hotel. Standard Room with King size bed/non smoking was nice and large. Bathrooms & Hallways need to be modernized. I felt they were clean but it felt old looking to me, not attractive at all. The bedding was very comfortable. We used the shuttle to go to Dinner at Ruth Chris. The driver gave us a card to call and reminded us last pick up was at 11pm, this was on a saturday nite. Driver was friendly and everyone on this full shuttle enjoyed this nice ammenity that the hotel offers, if it fits in your schedule. We actually had to walk from Olives (Martini Bar at Omni), back to the hotel. We thought we could hail a taxi on our walk back. We saw 2 taxis but, they had passengers. My husband and myself ended up walking back to hotel on foot. Ugh!!! Parking, I felt should have been cheaper. This hotel, I know is in a medical area, but, for their overnite guests, parking should be cheaper, being as its so far from center of downtown indy. On the morning of our checkout, my husband called and asked for a later one hour checkout. Being that we lost one hour due to time change this sunday morning. The lady told him, she was sorry, but she couldn't accomodate his request, they had to get ready for incoming guests. This hotel was in no way full that saturday nite, and I felt being the time change our request could've been honored. This hotel was rated 4 stars on hotwire. This is no way a 4 star hotel. The omni downtown was our last 4 star indy hotel we stayed previously to this on hotwire. We just were extremely disappointed. I would've rather stayed at a 3star hotel in Indy's downtown proper than this 3star, rated 4star hotel. We didn't feel staff was friendly or that the hotel should even list their bar and restaurant, since they close early on saturday nite. Just extremely disappointed with this hotel. Price was comparible to the omni I had previously on hotwire, be careful, it was probably 7 months ago I had gotten omni for around the same price. Repeat, this is not a 4star hotel........& shouldn't be labeled one.

Reviews.Title: “Wow--impressive!”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityTarheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in mid-October '06 for a conference I was attending at IUPUI and had previously stayed here at a conference about 6 years earlier. It was a fine place back then, but they have remodeled and made upgrades since then and the room I had was downright plush. The bed had a lush pillow-top mattress, an easy chair in which to relax, there was a 27" flat-screen TV, a great desk, office-style yet-stylish chair and hook-up for computer. Needless to say everything was clean, and the complimentary toiletries were worthy of a first-rate hotel. Had an a'la carte breakfast that was very satisfactory. All in all, the conference organizers were lucky they could coax me out of my room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Rebley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 4 days while he attended meetings for work. I loved this place. Everything was perfect and all the employees were very helpful. Our room was on the ninth floor and was tastefully decorated. The bed was very comfortable with a feather duvet on top. I've never been in a hotel with such great housekeeping. My room was cleaned in a timely fashion everyday. They didn't just come in and tidy up but gave an extensivley cleaning everyday. Towels, toiletries, sheets, were replaced everyday. Our bathroom was always spotless. We used the shuttle service once to got to Circle Centre Mall, our driver was very friendly and polite. When we wanted picked up he was there in 5 minutes. Great! There is a little food court in the hotel with Subway, Pizza, and a Gyro place that was convienent. If you don't mind walking about 1/2 mile you can also get to Tacobell/PizzaHut, Quiznos, Qdoba, PapaJohns, and a quaint little sandwhich shop. (We didn't rent a car) Only gripe I have about this place is that it's located on The Univeristy Of Indiana Purdue campus, so there's students everywhere, including lounging in the reception area of the hotel. There was nowhere to sit because students were relaxing with their laptops. We never had any problems with our keys they worked everytime. The gym was nice, used it everyday I was there, nice big plasmas to watch while you work out. There is also fruit everywhere in this hotel that's there for the taking, nice little perk. If I ever came back to indiana I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Jannaqq
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in room 925, to attend a conference held onsite at the hotel. I wasn't sure what to expect, with the hotel so close to the university. I would definitely stay at the University Place Hotel again. Rooms: I was at the end of the hallway (bonus = one more window with a different view). Room is very modern, great decor, high-end furnishings (marble countertop in bathroom, wood desk, chaise lounge, wonderfully comfortable king size bed with very clean linens and 5 pillows), flat screen LCD TV, comfortably sized bathroom with good water pressure and lots of thick towels, generous closet with mirrored doors, Molton Brown sundries, ceramic ionic blowdryer, radio that you can hook your MP3 player to. Food: we enjoyed the Bistro twice for breakfasts, their buffet was excellent. The hotel provided everything from box lunches to full lunch buffets to appetizers and cash bar, everything was excellent. Room access: never had a problem getting into my room. Room attendants: unintrusive, thorough, helpful. Front desk: everyone was helpful, no lines at checkout. Bellman very helpful in storing luggage until my room was ready. My early checkout arrived one day to early, but the front desk was very polite and extended my stay one day (to match my original request) and rescanned my room keys right away (and the room keys worked). Location: very close to Purdue and Indiana U. Hotel offers free shuttle service to nearby locations (we used this extensively to shop at Circle Center, dine at Slippery Noodle --where we saw Karen Allen and a few actors from Animal House, and enjoy several restaurants and martini bars in the area. Great drivers, always timely (they serve a 3-mile radius, never too long of a wait until the shuttle returns). Conference facilities: very good. Free internet access provided on the first floor with three stations. Note that it is a $30 one-way fare from airport to hotel by taxi, I would recommend the shared limo service instead (around $7).

Reviews.Title: “Will never book a room at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: Beachtraveler226
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for a team event in Indianapolis 6 months in advance and were charged a one night deposit. Had to cancell 1 month later due to injury and unable to attend event as a competitor. Hotel would not refund deposit, stating it was a non-refundable deposit. Hotel would not let me transfer deposit to another team member or give room to another family member for use. Hotel would not even let me change the reservation to another date. Would not recommend this hotel to any business or team planning to go to Indianapolis for an event. We have traveled all over the world and never had a hotel that would not work to solve a customer problem. Never book this hotel in advance and pay a deposit, they will not work with you in an emergency and you will loose your deposit!

HotelInfo.Name: University Place Conference Center & Hotel Indianapolis
HotelInfo.Address: 850 W Michigan St, Indianapolis, IN 46202
